title: How social media fxcked up the dating market
description:
Watch The Full Thing Here : 
————————————————————
Ready to build a network of amazing women and high-status men?

Michael’s Men of Action is a one-on-one Master’s program that teaches men how to create elite 
social lives by becoming higher status.

Click this link to learn how you can have a High-Status lifestyle now:
https://m.moamentoring.com/podcast

https://m.moamentoring.com/moa-community

channel_info.title: Michael Sartain
channel_info.description:
🎙Host of The Michael Sartain Podcast 

🔥Teaching you how to build a network of desirable women and high-status men

👇 Click the "Men of Action" link below now to forge a high-status lifestyle and join the elites

transcription: {"text": "Top 10% of men on dating apps get 63% of the right swipes. The top 20% of men get 83% of the right swipes, which means 80% of men are competing for 17% of women. Men right swipe 55% of the time, women right swipe 5% of the time on these dating apps. And 80% of the men on the apps are deemed to be unattractive. There's only 4.5% of men that are so attractive that women would actually make the first move. It's almost like because of social media and because women have access to so many men and they can left swipe. Think about what that would do to you mentally. If you could left swipe thousands of men and they start thinking, oh, I'm better than these men. I could date any of these men. They would all commit to me, which isn't true. And so you get into this situation where there's this evolutionary mismatch where you have these women competing for this very small group of men. And then when they date these men or sleep with them, then they complain about them because these men have so many options.
